reviewText: Classic
Skip this one and instead buy Aerosmith greatest hits and 20th century masters.  More hits, better value.
Great collection of hits.
Aerosmith at their best!
A decent Greatest Hits album but it will not please everyone
Classics!
Great tunes

Just CANNOT go wrong with Aerosmith tunes. Best news in R&R History was that Tyler and Perry realized the rest of the BAND deserved better treatment than their egos. Truly 1 plus 1 could only find the Square Root of One equals "1"
If you are a serious fanatic or just a casual listener of Aerosmith, this album is a great download for your digital collection.
I love this collection. You learn the words and you scream along. It's classic rock all the way subvesive, sappy and full of innuendo with a sense of humor. GREAT stuff.
Really great music by Aerosmith. Same old good rock music with quite an emphasis on ballad. I really like it. It's their best yet.
You love em til you die or you just don't get it.
Excellant
just some of their best
The album is all I expected it to be. No disappointment here.
Good music and good memories
Steve Tyler gets on my nerves but man can he sing.
Great classic Aerosmith! Takes u back to your favorite Aerosmith days! This is a must have CD to add to your collection.
Absolutely love it! It takes me back to my teens when that's all I would listen to.  Who doesn't love Steven Tyler?

Not a bad song on here if you are an Aerosmith fan... These are all tunes from the later more recent years of their career like Pump and Permanent Vacation not the classic Toys in the Attic and Rocks era... Rock on!
I'm a lover of this type of music. I get the MP3 downloads which hasn't been the best with Amazon's Downloading device this past 4 months which is why I knocked a star off.
Can't go wrong with Aerosmith!  All the hit songs on one CD is awesome.  Buy,  load onto play list and enjoy some great classic songs.
A fair number of hits are here, but it's still lacking some essential tracks. I bought it mostly because it was on sale. Certainly would never pay full price for this lackluster collection.
Aerosmith is the greatest rock and roll group of all time and this album highlights some of their biggest hits all in one place.  Amazing album!
I ordered this item for my son, and he has not complained.  It seems to work fine, and was delivered promptly.

I grew up listening to Aerosmith and a lot of other Rock groups. This is a good set of tunes from a hard rockin, hard partyin band. For me there is no "old" or "new" Aerosmith. It's Aerosmith. Toys in the Attic is also a good one. Still remember my Dad's face when he came home to "Big 10 Inch" rockin out of his console stereo (that was a stereo system with AM/FM, a turntable, and usually a reel to reel tape player in a fancy wood cabinet with 2 speakers built in.) Give it a shot & open your heart for some great rock! ;)
If you're looking for a compilation of all your favorite Aerosmith songs, this is it!  No more going from album to album picking out the good ones!

Like the title suggests some of Aerosmith's biggest known revival hits are on this release.  I think what should be on any compilation is subjective, but I think the point of this release was to gather a lot of hits in one place.  And that they did.

Big Ones is still a good release, and Big Fun to listen to.

Forget the negative reviews. This is a great collection of Aerosmith hits, post the "Sweet Emotion" era. Buy it and replace the ones you don't like with "Sweet Emotions" or "Walk this Way" or whatever.

Definitely one of the best videos to come out of promotion for the band. If it's a greatest hit, it's on this video. Highly recommended! Videos include, (not in order):

From PERMANENT VACATION:

Dude Looks Like A Lady Angel Rag Doll

From PUMP: Love in an Elevator Janie's Got a Gun What it Takes The Other Side

From GET A GRIP: Eat the Rich Living on the Edge Cryin' Amazing Crazy

From BIG ONES:

Walk on Water Blind Man Deuces Are Wild

If many of these happen to be your favorite Aerosmith tunes, then this is the video for you. It's awesome. Sit back, relax and look. :-D

The videos on this tape are: Deuces are Wild, Livin on the Edge, Eat the Rich, Amazing, Cryin, Crazy, Rag Doll, Angel, What it Takes, Love in an Elevator, Janies got a Gun, The Other Side, and Dude looks like a Lady.
There is also a few minutes intro to each video showing the making of the video, or some promotional spots they have done in other countries, or an ad for Rock the Vote, and some short interview footage.
It is high quality, and is about 90 minutes long. I cannot wait for their next VHS to be released... would love to have Pink, Jaded, and all their other 'new' stuff on tape as well. Highly recommended.
I LOVED THIS VIDEO. I HAD JUST SEEN THEIR CONCERT IN ALPINE VALLEY WISCONSIN AND WANTED MORE. THIS WAS IT. THEIR VIDEOS ARE AMAZING. IT KEPT ME GLUED TO MY SEAT, WHICH IS A HARD THING TO DO!
It shows you all the great videos plus a bunch of behind the scenes stuff too.  Not to mention some skin from the Deamon of Screamin

I think this is one of the best music videos I've ever seen. It has their best from '87-'93. Here's the lowdown for people who don't know what's here: 3 hits from "Permanent Vacation", 4 hits from  "Pump", 5 hits from "Get A Grip", plus a special video  made for the collection for "Deuces Are Wild" from "Beavis  & Butthead Experience" CD. I can't wait 'til Geffen gets off their  a** and puts this collection on DVD. The downside to the collection is it  don't have the (bar)video version of "What It Takes", "Walk  On Water", or "Blind Man" with Pamela Anderson playing the  nurse.
This video is great.  This tape has some of my favorite Aerosmith video's such as Cryin',Amazin' and Crazy, as well as video's I've never seen such as Livin' on the Edge and Angel. I loved it.
One of my favorite compilations.  All cuts are from CDs produced after they became clean and sober.  In my opinion, their most solid work.
Love it!
